newsitem.title: UK: Delcam nudges to premium on AIM debut.
newsitem.headline: Delcam nudges to premium on AIM debut.

text.p: Shares in computer software group Delcam Plc posted a modest 3.8 percent premium on their first day of dealings on the London Stock Exchange's Alternative Investment Market, dealers said.
Delcam shares, issued at 260p, gained 10p to 270p by 1005 GMT in thin volume.
The company raised about 1.7 million stg from its flotation, and said it would use the funds to develop its existing product portfolio and to promote sales growth in overseas markets.
Delcam supplies software and services for the design and manufacture of complex shapes, typically plastic injection moulds in the automotive industry.
It currently markets its products in over 40 countries and its customers include Mercedes-Benz, Nissan, Volkswagen, Gillette Co and Sharp Corporation .
The company said it had been profitable in every year since 1989 and made a pre-tax profit of one million stg in the year ended December 31 1996.
